front.title: Requirements for Securing SCTP Traffic using DTLS

abstract.t: The current specification of DTLS over SCTP is outdated and does not fulfill the requirements of 3GPP. This Internet Draft documents the requirements of 3GPP for securing SCTP based communications using DTLS. It is a results of a design team in TSVWG.

li.t: An SCTP implementation must support at least two streams used for reliable and in-sequence delivery.
Message size of at least 1 GB must be supported. It is known that currently user message size of 0.5 MB are in use.
Multihoming must be supported. However, support or dynamic address reconfiguration as specified in is not required.
The restart procedure must be supported.
Protocol mechanisms should not limit the availability of the communication (like the draining procedure in ).
User message sizes must not be limited by an protocol implementation (for example the size of send or receive buffers).
It is preferred to be able to use open source SCTP implementations.
Mutual authentication must be used with periodic re-authentication allowing a certificate update.
It must the possible to run DH once per hour or every 100GB.
Capabilities of an attacker still under discussion.
SCTP restart procedure should not allow attacks. Still under discussion.
